result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Randy A. Moore was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Randy A. Moore

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in person with Atty Robert Keller.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1119 - DE enters plea of no contest to Ct1 - found guilty by the Court. Remaining counts dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations. Defendant is sentenced to 10 days in the Kenosha County Jail w/ huber. DE given credit for Chpt. 85 treatment. Court orders a $350 fine plus costs, due in 30 days or civil judgment.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. DL suspended for 12 months.  Ignition interlock ordered. Intox assessment ordered. Appeals rights given.
From Atty. Keller with enclosed documents
from WCS. No contact with DE.
